metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4487 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted binary, related to "btypevec."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1

notes.Note: mdeslaur> same binutils commit as CVE-2016-2226

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.28-3ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1').
ht package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
nescc package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
sdcc package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
valgrind package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1').
